text: at first we were very hesitant to take
on this job because we are aware of
homeland reputation and we found it in
ethic the difficult job to take however
after some consideration we took the
meetings with the people and were
explicitly told to come up with our own
material to not emulate anything that
was on other worlds we was shown amongst
other things many Pro Bashar Assad
graffiti that was supposedly sprayed in
refugee camps which we found very
unrealistic people being this conflict
probably not want to talk about or want
to praise Bashar al-assad on their walls
so we got in touch with our friends and
relations and awesome to send us
proverbs and ideas what did the graffiti
actually say other things said the glory
and embosser which is repetition teaches
Bashar we had a graffiti which in the
voice of the people of the camp said
this show does not represent the views
of the artists we also did things like
black lives matter because the topic is
let's say bigger than just the
representation of Arabs we also wanted
to talk about representation or missing
representation of other ethnic groups
and we had homeland is racist which we
do believe y:i in particular that what
what prompted you to go with that slogan
we did watch the show in advance we
found that it had a very
undifferentiated representation both of
Arabs Muslims people from the so-called
Middle Eastern and South Asia region
which basically painted them one color
which is very black in this graffiti we
are trying to call for a more
differentiated view of the region and
we're trying to also say that things
aren't as simple as they seem on this
show and what kind of reaction have you
had to it
I'd say that so far the reaction has
been very positive
actually and what about from the the
show's producers what they've got they
said to you they have yet to comment on
this are there any other issues or
inaccuracies that that you have a
problem with in the program in the
series I mean for me personally I see
that we live in a very polarized world
at the moment and there is no need to
add fuel to an already very hot fire and
what we are basically calling for is for
people to look at each other as people
and as human beings rather than as
representations of self and the other
and to put a bit of time into getting to
know other cultures and the people that
they are talking for or against
